page.title: 15FISHING ON ST.MARTINS I.O.S.
page.content: In the summer of 1985 there are 7 boats fishing from St.Martins,plus four part timers.Only 2 of the 7 are Scillonian registered.The fishing code for Scillonian boats is "SC".The rest of the 7 are registered somewhere in Cornwall.Most inshore boats go out about 7 miles to do fishing,they tend to go for hake and monkfish.Some fishermen catch lobsters,crabs and crayfish with pots which are really traps.Damaged fish are placed into the pot to lure the crustaceans.Most fish are marketed through Lady Hamilton Fisheries and are sold on the continent.They are transported to the mainland on the ferry Scillonian 111.Fish are packed in ice,and the crustaceans are kept in water tanks to keep them alive because once they die they go bad very quickly.
